attributes.action: Allow Tyler Gregory Okonma (A.K.A. Tyler, the Creator) to enter the UK.
attributes.background: The reason for his ban was that his lyrics from an old album were homophobic and encouraged rape, however Mrs May did not realise that he took on a persona and he is not a homophobe nor encourage rape. His setlist does not include these songs and he encourages kids to find their wings, not to rape.
attributes.additional_details: His current setlist accessible via a search engine, his recent album cherry bomb which is not homophobic or misoginistic. http://www.theguardian.com/music/musicblog/2015/sep/01/tyler-the-creator-comments-banned-uk-freedom-of-speech    This article says all. You don't want more distrust for the conservatives do you Mrs May?

attributes.action: Ensure Fair access to mental health services and therapies, nationwide.
attributes.background:
The postcode lottery nature of health services must be stopped!! My personal concern is regarding mental health services & available therapies. 

There currently seems to be a one cure for all approach which is ludicrous and ineffectual, and ultimately causes the tax-payer extra money.
attributes.additional_details:
Most PCTs offer Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT). Many ONLY offer this form of therapy. Whereas CBT can offer excellent results for many people, it does not for others.
  It is distressing that all PCTs do not offer a substantial range of therapies. I know this would come at a cost to the NHS. However, it is well known that mental health diagnoses are increasing. It is also widely evidenced that treating mental health efficiently, would relieve stresses on the NHS, UK workforce, and economy.

attributes.action: Replace the current First Past The Post System with Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The current system of FPTP is leaving Local Elections in England and Wales with abnormal results. parties are gaining a higher percentage of seats compared with the actual vote they receive, which is leaving the majority of voters unrepresented at Council level.
attributes.additional_details:
For example, in Castle Point, a party achieved 37% of the vote but gained 60% of the seats, while another party there achieved 31% of the vote but gains no seats.

In Oldham, 49.1% of the vote was enough to gain 75% of the seats available.

We are calling for a fairer system to be put in place so that every vote counts.

attributes.action: Levy a 15% tax on shooting goods to fund moorland restoration and flood relief.
attributes.background: Heather burning and draining for the purpose of increasing red grouse production destroys peat and moss causing it to retain less water. As a result, heavy rain which used to be held by the peat and moss wetlands now makes fast runoff from the uplands and causes flooding in the valleys.
attributes.additional_details: Since the cause is specifically driven by the need to increase grouse numbers for shooting, it would seem appropriate that those causing the issue should bear the cost of reparation work. Therefore, I ask the government to impose an additional 15% charge on all shooting goods of all types, to fund restoration projects carried out by major conservation charities along with providing extra funding for those affected by the resulting flooding

attributes.action: Proclaim a UK Bank Holiday to celebrate HM The Queen's 90th birthday year.
attributes.background: The Queen's official birthday will fall on Saturday 11th June in 2016, marking Her Majesty's 90th birthday. This is a wonderful moment for our nation and will be marked with public holidays around the Commonwealth and with the closure of British High Commissions and Embassies. The UK should join in!
attributes.additional_details: Around the world, Commonwealth nations and oversees UK territories will celebrate with public holidays on either Fri 10th June or Mon 13th June. This petition calls for the same opportunity for the United Kingdom at some point between June 2016 and June 2017, the 90th year of The Queen's life.

attributes.action: Allow foreign nationals who are UK citizens of 3 yrs+ equal voting rights.
attributes.background: There are many foreign nationals living and working in the UK who have built businesses, set up families, own homes and who thus contribute to the UK economy in a way which should allow them a say regarding important decisions that affect them, such as the EU.

attributes.action: Hold a general Election in 2016 after the decision was made to leave the EU
attributes.background: The run up to the EU referendum has managed to prove that the Conservative government are not all of the same ideologies. In a time of vulnerability and Especially now the UK has to stand alone we need a Prime Minister that shows stability and integrity.

attributes.action: We want a points-based immigration system similar to Australia
attributes.background: This is your chance to make a change. We just want a means of regulating immigration to the United Kingdom. We are 'not racist' we need control. We need 1,000,000 signatures to stop this open boarders system and crazy immigration that is destroying Great Britain.
attributes.additional_details: 1. A failure to curb migration is corrosive of public trust in politics. 2. Voters had been promised that annual net immigration could be cut to the tens of thousands. 3. Net migration to Britain reached 333,000 in 2015, the second-highest level for a year since records began in 1975. We need your help.

attributes.action: Allow unaccompanied refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background:
According to Europol at least 10000 refugee children are missing. Europol  wans pan-European gangs are targeting minors for sex abuse and slavery.  
The adoption organisations Home for Good and Coram have somewhere between 9,000 and 10,000 families already offering to take unaccompanied minors.
attributes.additional_details:
The only restriction to these children being given one of these homes is current government policy. 
Let’s open the doors to the most vulnerable of children.

attributes.action: Putting signs on bridges and potential suicide spots offering support and hope.
attributes.background: Imagine feeling that there is no hope left in life, nothing to live for. These thoughts go through peoples heads daily and they consequently end their lives. Some people may have no one to talk to, but there are services that can help. I believe putting the information out there will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show that suicide is the biggest single killer of men under the age of 45. 
The idea of having signs has already been done in Japans Aokigahara Forest, where hundreds of people have gone to commit suicide. There are now signs which read  "Your life is something precious that was given to you by your parents" while another one states ''Do not be troubled alone." What i'm suggesting is signs with The Samaritans and other local mental health services details on to contact. There is help.

attributes.action: Remove restrictions on the cultivation of hemp.
attributes.background: Hemp produces a minimum of three crops from a single plant,produces fibres, hurds, flowers and seeds, each with a multitude of uses. Environmental impact even if growing wild is enormous, air quality, soil improvement.  Make hemp the UKs next renewable crop.  Lift all restrictions on its production

attributes.action: Give work permits to illegal immigrants living in the UK for over 3 years.
attributes.background:
UK Government should give work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years.
These illegal immigrants are from war torn or poverty stricken nations. To send them back to their countries is sending them to their deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
United Kingdom is a nation of compassionate, loving, hardworking, generous, hospitable and peaceful people.
Giving work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years and have no criminal record will lead to:
1. Increase in UK's work force
2. Increase in UK's sources of income.
3. Added values to British rich cultures
4. Increase in UK's leading role as the most compassionate and generous nation on earth.

attributes.action: Create "Purple Badge"; short term "disability" mobility rights for those in need
attributes.background: People with long term disability can get a blue badge to park in disabled spaces close to buildings. It's hard to get blue badge and if only needed temporarily eg broken leg, after surgery/chemo where walking long distances is hard. Petition for temporary blue badge, given out by medics for set time
attributes.additional_details: When a patient is ill eg after surgery or chemo, getting out can help recovery. However it can be very daunting leaving the house and if you have to park on the opposite side of a large car park this often puts people off going outside. You often need someone with you to support you so getting dropped off and then meeting someone as they park the car is not an option too. There needs to be something for people to get the justified disabled car parking spaces whilst they need it, deemed by a dr

attributes.action: Thinner lenses be free on the NHS for those registered partially sighted/blind
attributes.background: I was registered as partially sighted at 16 and blind at 19. My eyesight is constantly deteriorating and at a quicker pace than most. The need for glasses is essential. I now require complex lenses, thinner lenses are essential and they are very costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Those with complex lenses do get a voucher but that only equates to approximately £14. One pair of glasses cost me nearly £300.

The buy one get one free offers advertised do not include thinner lenses so if a second pair is required (eg prescription sunglasses which with some conditions light has a major impact) you have to pay twice for the lenses.

I currently have thinner lenses in my latest pair and from the side they are at least 0.75cm thick so would be considerably worse without

attributes.action: To make sure all voulunteers on school trips are DBS/CRB checked
attributes.background: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked.
attributes.additional_details: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked. This means that the person caring for a child for the day could have anything on their criminal record and the school would not know about this.

attributes.action: The UK should negotiate with Australia to form a union between the two nations.
attributes.background:
If Scotland leaves the union England will be weaker on the world stage. The economy will fall, quality of life will plummet, etc. 
I propose a debate that involves the UK parliament to negotiate with the Australian parliament to form a union between the two.

attributes.action: Let the people of the UK decide if it should be split by Scotland's departure.
attributes.background: Scots had a referendum to decide if Scotland should be independent - and decided against. If they decide to try again there should be a referendum of the whole of the UK instead - the decision is bigger than just what Scotland wants - it is about what the UK wants and the future of our country.

attributes.action: Provide obese people with specialist help in their locality - it's their right
attributes.background: NHS guidelines say obese patients should have access to dedicated centres, staffed by experts in weight loss, exercise, and talking therapies, to help them reverse their weight gain prior to bariatric surgery. But this can be a postcode lottery.
attributes.additional_details: Obesity is often about much more than “just eat less”, otherwise millions of people would have just taken that advice. Guidelines recommend that prior to offering bariatric surgery (Tier 4) the NHS should provide help through dedicated centres staffed by experts in weight loss, exercise, and talking therapies, to help obese patients lose weight (Tier 3). This petition calls for more Tier 3 centres so all obese patients are able to access Tier 3 as a right.

attributes.action: Give mandatory sentences for criminal cases involving Child pornography
attributes.background:
Ex-Etonian Andrew Picard was given 10 month suspended prison sentence after thousands of child pornography images and clips were found on his hard drive.    Some shown children as young as two being raped and forced to have sex with dogs.

Give child pornography crimes mandatory sentences!!!
attributes.additional_details:
Number of detected crimes of people accessing child porn images increased by 46% between 2007-11 (BBC).

Up to 35,000 indecent images of children were found every day by police, some offenders caught with over 1 million.  In 1990 (pre internet boom) there were just 7,000 hard copy images in circulation.

The internet has unfortunately made child pornography more accessible.  Basic human rights should be respected by ALL UK citizens regardless of background, wealth and positions of power.

attributes.action: Investigate the appalling service provided by Southern Rail during 2016
attributes.background: This year many trains have been cancelled by this company outside of industrial action. The company have cited staff shortages. But this is happening every day of every week. Surely their planning &/or HR department should & could have seen this coming.
attributes.additional_details: Only today two trains have been cancelled on the southern network. The 08:09 Southampton central & 08:30 Chichester. Many people rely on these services including school children who may be left venerable waiting on platforms when their parents are expecting them at a different time. This is a shocking service and needs to be resolved.

attributes.action: Offer all new parents the chance to learn lifesaving baby CPR
attributes.background:
In an unresponsive child, the first few minutes of first aid that is administered can be the difference between life & death.
If parents were given the opportunity to learn lifesaving CPR skills, more infant deaths could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently attended a first aid course. To see someone preform CPR on a small, lifeless baby (in this case it was just a training doll) hit me hard. I have three children. My youngest is just under a year old. And in an emergency, before that day, I wouldn't have known what to do. 
The skills I learnt that day made me realise all new parents should be offered basic training as part of the many after care checks taken by health professionals. One day, that parent may end up having to use it.

attributes.action: Remove the 20% VAT that owners of sick pets are forced to pay.
attributes.background: I am a pet owner and live on a small income. My dog has helped me in lots of ways helped me through some tough times. I find 20% VAT on vet operations a rip off by this government for many pet owners and also many of those who are on small pensions.

attributes.action: Make  UK licensed bookmakers accept bets up to a minimum liability of £1000
attributes.background: It has become a common practice for bookmakers within the UK and those  that operate in the UK to restrict or close the account of  customers and / or to exempt some customers from participating in advertised promotions or enhanced  offers. These  widespread practises are unfair and  discriminate.
attributes.additional_details:
Special Terms should continue to be allowed to  apply to enhanced offers and  advertised promotions which may limit bet size  but changes must be made for all customers to be able to participate , without exclusion or  discrimination.

New South Wales, Australia  has recognised these  inequities  and has legislated to introduced the type of  regulation  we ask for in this petition.

attributes.action: Upgrade the A34 to modern 3 lane motorway standards.
attributes.background: The A34 is a very busy dual carriageway carrying ever increasing levels of traffic between the Midlands and down to the South Coast. The road was built for a bygone era and is no longer fit for purpose. There have now been numerous fatalities and serious accidents on this road in recent times.
attributes.additional_details: With the exception of the Newbury Bypass and the improved junction with the M4, the rest of the road from the M40 all the way down to Winchester was constructed in the 1970s. Bends, gradients, junctions and sight lines are not up to modern standards. The solution would be to widen and totally reconstruct the road, realigning it where necessary. If needed, funds could be found by not spending £900+ million earmarked for making the M4 around Reading a "smart motorway". The A34 is much more urgent.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to review how the Honours & Forfeiture Committees Operate
attributes.background: In light of the recent news relating to Philip Green & BHS, I call on the Government to review how the Honours and Forfeiture Committees operate and to consider changing the process for taking honours away.

attributes.action: Make Diabetics exempt from the sugar tax
attributes.background: Diabetics with a low blood sugar level need to consume glucose to stop progression to unconsciousness and possibly death. A glucose drink can be used, which can cost around £3.80 for a pack of 6. The sugar tax will increase the cost. This is unfair to the Diabetic population who need these drinks!
attributes.additional_details:
I wrote to the Department of Health in July 2015 outlining my concerns for Diabetics if a sugar tax were to be introduced, and received a reply which said: "The Government has no plans to introduce a sugar tax."

My concerns were obviously not taken into account when the announcement of a sugar tax was made.

attributes.action: Improve the A21. Eliminate blindspots and place speed cameras along Kent street
attributes.background: There have been a number of fatalities along Kent street in 2016. One being on the 13 of August. Vast stretches of the a21 are seriously outdated and need improving. I'm asking that the government improve the a21 especially Kent street, by eke imitating blindspots and placing average speed cameras.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of letters to the government by residents of Kent street asking for changes, but nothing has been done. All the plans to improve the a21 have been shelved, and I'm asking that the government step in and change the road. 4 fatalities this year are evidence that something needs to be done.

attributes.action: End the Breed Specific Legislation
attributes.background: BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This is a petition to end the BSL. A new law should be brought in to replace the Dangerous Dogs act to ensure responsibility for a dog’s behaviour is placed on the owner or person in charge of it.
attributes.additional_details: It is the owners responbility to control there own dog or a dog they are in charge of. Also to seek help if their dog or a dog they are in charge of shows signs of aggression or behavioural problems.

attributes.action: Reduce the validity period of Energy Performance Certificates to 1 year.
attributes.background: When selling or renting a property an EPC must be produced and provided to any potential buyer or tenant prior to the property being marketed. Currently the certificate is valid for 10 years and can be very misleading as a property rating may have increased or decreased due to modifications.
attributes.additional_details: It is my opinion that the EPC provided to the property purchaser or tenant should be an up to date document giving the current rating of the property. The EPC should be no more than 6 months old to give a true reflection of current running costs and an up to date reflection of the current heating system and insulation measures.

attributes.action: Decrease the amount universities can charge students for their tuition fees.
attributes.background: It is well known how much debt students will be left with once they have graduated from their respective degrees. It is time for parliament to review the maximum amount of tuition fees being charged to students in the U.K, as well as offering more financial support to those from low income families.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-34721681
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-26954901
http://www.independent.co.uk/student/news/jeremy-corbyn-england-should-be-utterly-ashamed-of-having-highest-tuition-fees-in-industrialised-a6860556.html

attributes.action: Clean Up City Air: Ban Harmful Diesel Engined, Air-Polluting Public Transport
attributes.background: Public transport should not cause harm to public health. Diesel exhaust is one of the biggest causes of air pollution, which is linked to 40,000 early deaths every year, causing diseases including cancer, dementia, and heart disease. It is time for a healthy alternative energy for public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal College of Physicians recently stated "The health problems resulting from exposure to air pollution have a high cost to society and business, our health services, and people who suffer from illness and premature death. In the UK, these costs add up to more than £20 billion every year.  Taking action will reduce pain, suffering and demands on the NHS, while getting people back to work, learning, and an active life. The value of these benefits far exceeds the cost of reducing emissions."

attributes.action: Stop the temporary closure of brookside children and adolescent unit
attributes.background: As you may or not know brookside is temporary closing down and for so many young children and families that is devastation. The unit covers four boroughs and takes referrals from all over the country. There is a waiting list of kids in crisis for this unit and many who need help being discharged.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS are already inundated with referrals and are having to turn people away. Yet with the closure of brookside they are going to be under more pressure and local hospitals and crisis teams are going to be stretched out with the lack of hospital beds. There is no beds in the country whilst brookside is open how can this mental health system afford to loose 18 inpatient and 16 day patient beds.
Please do not let another child be a statistic because there was no safe place.

attributes.action: Reopen Adcote House, Birkenhead, education unit to assess child's mental health
attributes.background: Adcote house, Birkenhead offers an educational unit with placements to help assess the mental health needs of children and young people. Due to government cut backs the unit is closed and many children including our 7 year old son who would be offered a placement aren't getting their needs met.
attributes.additional_details: Our 7 year old son is having assessments at CAMHS. He is a loving little boy whose emotional and social struggles affect him in everyday life, particularly the school environment. He would now be offered a 6 week educational placement at Adcote house to further assess his needs and get him the support he deserves. Frustratingly, he along with so many other children aren't getting their needs met due to government cut backs. Please help reopen a lifeline for families in already difficult times.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile phones while driving an instant driving ban.
attributes.background: Everyone now knows it's illegal yet the problem is growing, people are dying and being seriously injured in increasing numbers. I drive for a living and am amazed daily by this problem, drivers texting while driving on motorways is just one I see almost daily.needs treating same as drink driving

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage of 18-20 year olds to that of 21 year olds
attributes.background: The current minimum wage for 18-20 year olds in the UK is £5.30. The current minimum wage for 21- 24 year olds is £6.70. This is a huge gap even though the cost of living is exactly the same; the cost of food, rent and bills is not lower - so why is the rate of pay?
attributes.additional_details: For every 40 hours a 21 year old works, an 18 year old has to work an additional 10 hours to earn the same amount of money - this is essentially an extra week's worth of work every month.18-20 year olds are constantly exploited in the workplace because of this. Working for 200 hours pays around £1,060 before tax and national insurance, working for the recommended 160 hours pays around £870. For a whole month this is not enough for an independent person to live off.

attributes.action: An unelected Prime Minister should call a general election within 6 months
attributes.background: In the interests of sovereignty, an unelected UK Prime Minister should hold a general election within six months of taking office.

attributes.action: Open up the 16-24 age bracket for the Creative Employment Programme to 30+
attributes.background: The Creative Employment Programme is a £15m fund to support the creation of traineeships, formal apprenticeship and paid internship opportunities in England for young unemployed people aged 16-24 wishing to pursue a career in the arts and cultural sector.
attributes.additional_details:
This age cap should be opened up to at least 30 years old as is unfair to anyone over the age of 24 trying to get an entry level position within creative industries. This policy is ageist and due to it's popularity with employers able to get funding to support the job position there are many jobs that cannot be obtained by people over 24 purely because of their age.

The position should go to the person that best fits the job role and not to how old they are.

attributes.action: Make publishing a false statement illegal
attributes.background: A publication that makes a factually incorrect statement – for whatever reason – and is proved to have done so, will have to publish a correction in the same prominence, location and size as the original false statement.
attributes.additional_details:
In a democracy, the key for debating and arguing ideas is a respect for the facts on which we base our opinions and views of the world. It’s the level playing field we must all respect. Opinions, predictions, and forecasts are quite different and would not be covered by such a law so long as they are clearly noted as such.  

This proposed law is not intended to cover persons as that is already covered by the law of slander and libel.

attributes.action: To consider protecting CC41&11011 the historic symbols under IPO article 6_ter
attributes.background: I would like you to consider protecting the historic expired marks CC41 and 11011 under article 6_ter or equivalent Non EU regulation so that it remains free to use by the people and not that of sole property of an individual so that they are able to gain financial reward.
attributes.additional_details: It recently came to my attention that an individual has successfully published the iconic CC41, I intend to fully challange the Mark personally and have appealed and invited the millions of Brits to join me in this campaign,  so that the trademark CC41 is not granted solely to the individual Mr Douglas Steward, further information of this can be found on the IPO website under the words "CC41" The double 11s symbol 11011, another iconic symbol I also wish you to consider protecting.

attributes.action: A curriculum for the future. Give the youth a voice with in the education system
attributes.background:
We want a compulsory PHSE, that includes the following subjects :
•	Political, economics and current affairs. 
•	Wellbeing- basic life skills, mental health
•	Community cohesion & Cultural awareness-Justice, equality, discrimination
•	Finance, employment and enterprise
•	Social responsibility
attributes.additional_details:
Consultation with in schools and youth clubs in Manchester.
UKYP, National make your mark consultation- Curriculum for life coming in top 5 for 3 consecutive times.

attributes.action: Abolish same roof rule and 1979 rule for historic sexual abuse victims
attributes.background: If you were abused by a family member living in the same household the Ministry of Justice thinks that's ok. If your abuse ended prior to October 1979 that's ok too. The CICA will not pay out any form of compensation if you fall into either of these categories, an unfair and unjust rule.
attributes.additional_details: My father and mother were recently jailed for what he did to me as a child I and my sisters were told to make a claim for compensation. We did but as my abuse ended in July 1979 and it was my father that sexually abused me the law says it was ok and I am entitled to nothing. This is not about the money this is about another slap in the face for abuse victims coming forward it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Guidance on workplace bullying must be applied to behaviour of MPs at work.
attributes.background: The rules covering conduct during parliamentary debate must be updated to reflect the level of conduct expected generally in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like our representatives to treat each other with respect, to listen properly to each others views, to debate the matter at hand and to answer direct questions with full and truthful answers.

("Bullying may be characterised as offensive, intimidating, malicious or insulting behaviour, an abuse or misuse of power through means that undermine, humiliate, denigrate or injure the recipient." - From the ACAS website)

attributes.action: Unemployment and behaviour rehabilitation.  National service.
attributes.background:
1. Children/Adults on leaving school will be enrolled in a national service programme if they are not in employment or further education with 3 months of leaving school.

2. Young offenders 16-25 are entered into the national service programme for rehabilitation.
attributes.additional_details:
1a. They will recieve a set of skills and further education for a good platform in life and to be a working citizen.
1b. They recieve a wage which pays taxes back not benefits.
1c. Money taken and put into a fund for them when service is finished to help them with a start in life.

2a. Takes down over crowding in prisons.
2b. Gives them a set of skills and trade to give back something to community's. Something were they feel wanted.
2c. Reduces tax payers costs to prisoners.
2d. Pays taxes back.

attributes.action: Life Imprisonment for the abuse, neglect and ill-treatment of children.
attributes.background: After reading of yet another child abused and eventually dying at the hands of the person who should have cared for her, we know in the past, sentencing in similar situations is lenient. If life imprisonment is mandatory upon conviction, it may act as a deterrent or stop the continuing abuse

attributes.action: Make cat owners responsible for their cats fouling on private property
attributes.background: Cat fouling on private property is not treated with the same seriousness as dogs. There has been a huge cultural shift with personal ownership of dog fouling and feel this should now be extended to cats
attributes.additional_details:
Cat fouling on private property is frowned upon, but perfectly legal in the UK, whereas dogs, for example, if caught fouling in public places, would have their owner fined, if caught. Cats are allowed to foul wherever they please, while dog's excrement must be picked up and put in special bins, or cleaned if the dog did not even belong to you. Cat poo has toxins in it, and in some cases is as dangerous as dog poo. There are obvious health risks associated with this, especially to young children.
This petition stands for fines to be placed on a cat's owner if there is evidence (photographic or video) that the cat had fouled on the property. Should there be a call for cats to be kept on leads?

attributes.action: The government must ensure schools provide instrumental lessons for all pupils
attributes.background: It has been proved beyond question that the experience of learning a musical instrument and playing in musical ensembles with others provides a complete 'brain work out' - developing skills that are not just related to music but also skills that enhance both learning and development throughout life
attributes.additional_details: There have been numerous studies showing the cognitive development of children who play an instrument when compared to those that don't and all the evidence makes it quite clear that the the benefits of learning a musical instrument helps education and development in all subjects for everyone as the skills required for instrumental playing are all essential skills in everyday life.

attributes.action: Cancel the Validity of the EU referendum as the government held it illegally.
attributes.background: No votes for European residents but votes for Commonwealth residents. None for long standing Brits living elsewhere in the EU. The result is too marginal to call decisive. The 2 million EU citizens working and living  in the UK directly affected by this should be given a vote at a new referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendums are one off events, so the rules about who can vote are different each time. www.electoralcommission.org.uk

Millions of EU UK Citizens have helped this country be the success it has been. A set of voting eligibility rules should have been laid out for EU citizens who have been here a certain amount of time, made the UK their home and contributed.

attributes.action: Introduce NHS funding for Forensic Psychology doctorate students
attributes.background: The NHS funds Clinical Psychology doctoral students so that they are able to complete their training whilst earning a fair salary. This means that anyone can apply to do the Clinical Psychology doctorate. The Forensic Psychology doctorate is not only NOT funded, but must be paid for (over £7000/yr).
attributes.additional_details: The Forensic Psychology doctorate is a professional training course during which you are on placement full-time, whilst also conducting thesis research. However, the full-time work that students undertake on placements (often within NHS establishments, e.g. secure hospitals) is completely unpaid. This means that Forensic Psychology doctorate students have to find a way to pay the course fees and be able to work for free for 2 years. I believe the Forensic Doctorate should be funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Motorcycle filtering signs.
attributes.background: to lower the risk of deaths and near misses on the UK motorways, filtering signs to be placed on the gang ways above motorways or on the side of roads informing other motorists to look out for bikes. Also stipulate the legal filtering speed limits in the highway code.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the amount of motorcycle deaths and/or near misses on the UK roads down to filtering, as a road safety intensive nation wide I feel the government should introduce a filtering sign along UK roads, to remind other road users of filtering bikes and the legalities (stated in section 88 of the highway code) to be move vigilant for filtering motorcycles.

attributes.action: Make the provision of free public toilets a legal requirement for local councils
attributes.background: Public toilets are not legally require to be provided by local authorities, which means that they are often closed to save money. As urinating or defecating on the street is illegal it effectively means that a person has to spend money in a private establishment in order to use the toilets.
attributes.additional_details:
"Joan Dean said her husband Brian, who has Parkinson's Disease, was left humiliated when he wet himself after failing to find a toilet on a trip to Levenshulme, in Manchester, where 18 toilets have been closed in the last 10 years."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36405414

People who are vulnerable, ill, homeless or on low income might not be able to use private facilities yet face legal action if they urinate or defecate on the street. This is an affront to dignity and needs to be addressed.
